conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the transparent object for the given monochromatic light.
The semi-cylindrical object has a radius R. The light enters at point C, which is at a distance of \( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R \) from the center O.
The light enters at point C and travels along the radius OC.
The angle of incidence \( \theta_i \) is the angle between the incident ray and the normal at point C.
Calculate the angle of incidence using trigonometry: \( \cos(\theta_i) = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} \), \( \theta_i = \cos^{-1}\left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}\right) \).
Snell's Law: \( n_1 \sin(\theta_i) = n_2 \sin(\theta_r) \), where \( n_1 = 1 \) (air), and \( n_2 \) is the refractive index of the object.
At the critical angle, the refracted ray travels along the boundary, so \( \theta_r = 90^\circ \), \( \sin(\theta_r) = 1 \).
Using Snell's Law, solve for the refractive index: \( n_2 = \sin(\theta_i) \).
The refractive index \( n_2 \) of the transparent object is \( \frac{\sqrt{6}}{3} \).
